alert.note: Alert for Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Walker and Dade Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 312 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms extended from near Bridgeport to near Higdon to Henagar, and moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Trenton, Fort Oglethorpe, Chickamauga, Lookout Mountain, Center Post, Rising Fawn, Noble, Cole City, Wildwood, Fairview, Stephensville, Chattanooga Valley, New England, Morganville, Hooker, Cloudland Canyon State Park and Cooper Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northwestern Georgia.
